Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

25  KSNavMeshedSpace::KSNavMeshedSpace():
26  fFileName(""),
27  fExitSplit(false),
28  fEnterSplit(false),
29  fFailCheck(false),
30  fRelativeTolerance(1e-2),
31  fAbsoluteTolerance(1e-3),
32  fRootSpace(NULL),
33  fMaxDepth(8),
34  fSpecifyMaxDepth(false),
35  fSpatialResolution(1e-6),
36  fSpecifyResolution(false),
37  fNAllowedElements(1),
38  fSpecifyAllowedElements(false)
39  {
40  }

42  KSNavMeshedSpace::KSNavMeshedSpace( const KSNavMeshedSpace& aCopy ):
43  KSComponent(),
44  fFileName(aCopy.fFileName),
45  fExitSplit(aCopy.fExitSplit),
46  fEnterSplit(aCopy.fEnterSplit),
47  fFailCheck(aCopy.fFailCheck),
48  fRelativeTolerance(aCopy.fRelativeTolerance),
49  fAbsoluteTolerance(aCopy.fAbsoluteTolerance),
50  fRootSpace(aCopy.fRootSpace),
51  fMaxDepth(aCopy.fMaxDepth),
52  fSpecifyMaxDepth(aCopy.fSpecifyMaxDepth),
53  fSpatialResolution(aCopy.fSpatialResolution),
54  fSpecifyResolution(aCopy.fSpecifyResolution),
55  fNAllowedElements(aCopy.fNAllowedElements),
56  fSpecifyAllowedElements(aCopy.fSpecifyAllowedElements)
57  {
58  //this would be is slow if we copy the navigator a lot
59  InitializeComponent();
60  }

62  KSNavMeshedSpace* KSNavMeshedSpace::Clone() const

67  KSNavMeshedSpace::~KSNavMeshedSpace()

70 
71  void
72  KSNavMeshedSpace::CollectMeshElements()
73  {
74  //temp space
75  KSSpace* tSpace;
76  fSpaces.clear();
77  fSides.clear();
78  fSurfaces.clear();
79 
80  //starting with the root space, we need to retrieve all of the surfaces, spaces and sides it contains
81  //recursively iterate over the objects in the root space
82  std::queue< KSSpace* >* spaceQueue = new std::queue< KSSpace* >();
83  spaceQueue->push(fRootSpace);
84 
85  if(fRootSpace == NULL)
86  {
87  navmsg( eError ) << "please check your configuration, the root space has not been specified!" << eom;
88  }
89 
90  while( !(spaceQueue->empty()))
91  {
92  tSpace = spaceQueue->front();
93 
94  //collect this space if it is a geo space
95  KSGeoSpace* geo_space = dynamic_cast< KSGeoSpace* >(tSpace);
96  if(geo_space != NULL)
97  {
98  navmsg_debug( " navigator <"<<GetName()<<"> is collecting the space <"<< geo_space->GetName() << "> for meshing " << eom );
99  fSpaces.push_back(geo_space);
100  };
101 
102  //collect the surfaces that are children of this space and are geo surfaces
103  for(int i=0; i<tSpace->GetSurfaceCount(); i++)
104  {
105  KSGeoSurface* geo_surface = dynamic_cast< KSGeoSurface* >(tSpace->GetSurface(i));
106  if(geo_surface != NULL)
107  {
108  navmsg_debug( " navigator <"<<GetName()<<"> is collecting the surface <"<< geo_surface->GetName() << "> for meshing " << eom );
109  fSurfaces.push_back(geo_surface);
110  }
111  }
112 
113  //collect the sides of this space that are geo sides
114  for(int i=0; i<tSpace->GetSideCount(); i++)
115  {
116  KSGeoSide* geo_side = dynamic_cast< KSGeoSide* >(tSpace->GetSide(i));
117  if(geo_side != NULL)
118  {
119  navmsg_debug( " navigator <"<<GetName()<<"> is collecting the side <"<< geo_side->GetName() << "> for meshing " << eom );
120  fSides.push_back(geo_side);
121  }
122  }
123 
124  //add this spaces children to the queue
125  if( tSpace->GetSpaceCount() != 0)
126  {
127  for(int i=0; i < tSpace->GetSpaceCount(); i++)
128  {
129  spaceQueue->push( tSpace->GetSpace(i) );
130  }
131  }
132  //pop this space off the queue
133  spaceQueue->pop();
134  };
135  delete spaceQueue;
136 
137  //now we discretize the KGeoBag objects
138  //construct the mesh element to parent entity map
139  //and collect the mesh elements for the octree container
140  fElementMap.clear();
141  KGMesher tMesher;
142  fCollector.SetElementMap(&fElementMap);
143  fCollector.SetMeshElementContainer(&fElementContainer);
144  //do spaces
145  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSpaces.size(); i++)
146  {
147  fCollector.SetSpace(fSpaces[i]);
148  std::vector< KGSpace* > spaces = fSpaces[i]->GetContent();
149  for(unsigned int j=0; j<spaces.size(); j++)
150  {
151  if( !(spaces[j]->HasExtension< KGMesh >()) )
152  {
153  //no mesh extension, better make it first
154  spaces[j]->MakeExtension< KGMesh >();
155  spaces[j]->AcceptNode( &tMesher );
156  }
157 
158  //now collect the mesh and map the elements to the KSSpace
159  spaces[j]->AcceptNode(&fCollector);
160  }
161  }
162 
163  //do sides
164  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSides.size(); i++)
165  {
166  fCollector.SetSide(fSides[i]);
167  std::vector< KGSurface* > sides = fSides[i]->GetContent();
168  for(unsigned int j=0; j<sides.size(); j++)
169  {
170  if( !(sides[j]->HasExtension< KGMesh >()) )
171  {
172  //no mesh extension, better make it first
173  sides[j]->MakeExtension< KGMesh >();
174  sides[j]->AcceptNode( &tMesher );
175  }
176  //now collect the mesh and map the elements to the KSSide
177  sides[j]->AcceptNode(&fCollector);
178  }
179  }
180 
181  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSurfaces.size(); i++)
182  {
183  fCollector.SetSurface(fSurfaces[i]);
184  std::vector< KGSurface* > surfaces = fSurfaces[i]->GetContent();
185  for(unsigned int j=0; j<surfaces.size(); j++)
186  {
187  if( !(surfaces[j]->HasExtension< KGMesh >()) )
188  {
189  //no mesh extension, better make it first
190  surfaces[j]->MakeExtension< KGMesh >();
191  surfaces[j]->AcceptNode( &tMesher );
192  }
193  //now collect the mesh and map the elements to the KSSurface
194  surfaces[j]->AcceptNode(&fCollector);
195  }
196  }
197  }
198 
199  void
200  KSNavMeshedSpace::ConstructTree()
201  {
202  bool haveTree = RetrieveTree();
203 
204  if(!haveTree)
205  {
206  navmsg(eNormal) << "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> is constructing the region octree..." << eom ;
207 
208  if(fSpecifyMaxDepth)
209  {
210  fTreeBuilder.SetMaxTreeDepth(fMaxDepth);
211  }
212 
213  if(fSpecifyResolution)
214  {
215  fTreeBuilder.SetSpatialResolution(fSpatialResolution);
216  }
217 
218  if(fSpecifyAllowedElements)
219  {
220  fTreeBuilder.SetNAllowedElements(fNAllowedElements);
221  }
222 
223  fTreeBuilder.SetNavigableMeshElementContainer(&fElementContainer);
224  fTreeBuilder.SetTree(&fTree);
225  fTreeBuilder.ConstructTree();
226 
227  std::string octree_info = fTreeBuilder.GetInformation();
228  navmsg(eNormal) << "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> octree structure is...\n" << octree_info << eom;
229 
230  SaveTree();
231  }
232  else
233  {
234  navmsg(eNormal) << "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> reconstructed an octree from <"<<fFileName<<">" << eom;
235  }
236 
237  fWorldCube = KGObjectRetriever<KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects, KGCube<KGMESH_DIM> >::GetNodeObject(fTree.GetRootNode());
238 
239  //if no user specified tolerance, automatically try to estimate one
240  if(!fUserSpecifiedAbsoluteTolerance)
241  {
242  double world_length = fWorldCube->GetLength();
243  fAbsoluteTolerance = fRelativeTolerance*( world_length/std::pow(2.0, fMaxDepth) );
244  }
245  };
246 
247  void KSNavMeshedSpace::SaveTree()
248  {
249  KSNavOctreeData data;
250 
251  //compute a unique id tag for this tree
252  //based on entity names, tree parameters and number of mesh elements
253 
254  std::stringstream se;
255  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSpaces.size(); i++){se << fSpaces[i]->GetName();}
256  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSides.size(); i++){se << fSides[i]->GetName();}
257  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSurfaces.size(); i++){se << fSurfaces[i]->GetName();}
258  se << fElementMap.size();
259  std::string temp = se.str();
260 
261  //compute a hash for entity data
262  KMD5HashGenerator entity_hasher;
263  std::string entity_hash = entity_hasher.GenerateHashFromString( temp );
264 
265  //concatenate the parameters and hash them too
266  std::stringstream sp;
267  sp << fSpecifyMaxDepth;
268  sp << fSpecifyResolution;
269  sp << fSpecifyAllowedElements;
270 
271  if(fSpecifyMaxDepth){ sp << fMaxDepth; };
272  if(fSpecifyResolution){ sp << fSpecifyResolution; };
273  if(fSpecifyAllowedElements){ sp << fNAllowedElements; };
274  temp = sp.str();
275 
276  KMD5HashGenerator param_hasher;
277  std::string param_hash = param_hasher.GenerateHashFromString( temp );
278 
279  //make and set the unique_id
280  std::stringstream us;
281  us << entity_hash.substr(0,6);
282  us << param_hash.substr(0,6);
283  std::string unique_id = us.str();
284  data.SetTreeID( unique_id );
285 
286  //set the tree parameters
287  data.SetMaximumOctreeDepth(fMaxDepth);
288  data.SetSpecifyMaximumOctreeDepth(0);
289  if(fSpecifyMaxDepth){ data.SetSpecifyMaximumOctreeDepth(1);};
290 
291  data.SetSpatialResolution(fSpatialResolution);
292  data.SetSpecifySpatialResolution(0);
293  if(fSpecifyResolution){data.SetSpecifySpatialResolution(1);};
294 
295  data.SetNumberOfAllowedElements(fNAllowedElements);
296  data.SetSpecifyNumberOfAllowedElements(0);
297  if(fSpecifyAllowedElements){data.SetSpecifyNumberOfAllowedElements(1);};
298 
299  //flatten the tree
300  KGTreeStructureExtractor< KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects > flattener;
301  fTree.ApplyRecursiveAction(&flattener);
302 
303  //set number of tree nodes
304  data.SetNumberOfTreeNodes( flattener.GetNumberOfNodes() );
305 
306  //set the flattend tree data
307  data.SetFlattenedTree( flattener.GetFlattenedTree() );
308 
309  //collect the identity sets and the associated node data
310  KGObjectCollector< KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects , KGIdentitySet > id_set_collector;
311  fTree.ApplyCorecursiveAction(&id_set_collector);
312  data.SetIdentitySetNodeIDs( id_set_collector.GetCollectedObjectAssociatedNodeIDs() );
313  data.SetIdentitySets( id_set_collector.GetCollectedObjects() );
314 
315  //collect the cubes and associated node data
316  KGObjectCollector< KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects, KGCube<KGMESH_DIM> > cube_collector;
317  fTree.ApplyCorecursiveAction(&cube_collector);
318  data.SetCubeNodeIDs( cube_collector.GetCollectedObjectAssociatedNodeIDs() );
319  data.SetCubes( cube_collector.GetCollectedObjects() );
320 
321  //stream the data out to file
322  std::vector< std::string > labels;
323  labels.push_back( entity_hash );
324  labels.push_back( param_hash );
325  labels.push_back( unique_id );
326  labels.push_back( GetName() );
327 
328  if(fFileName == "")
329  {
330  time_t t = time(0);
331  struct tm * now = localtime(&t);
332  std::stringstream s;
333  s << "KSOctree_"
334  << (now->tm_year + 1900) << '-'
335  << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2) << (now->tm_mon + 1) << '-'
336  << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2) << now->tm_mday << "_"
337  << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2) << now->tm_hour << "-"
338  << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2) << now->tm_min << "-"
339  << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2) << now->tm_sec
340  << ".kbd";
341  fFileName = s.str();
342  }
343 
344  //we use the kemfield file interface
345  if ( fPath == "" )
346  {
347  fPath = SCRATCH_DEFAULT_DIR;
348  }
349  std::string file = fPath + "/" + fFileName;
350 
351  KEMFileInterface::GetInstance()->Write(file, data, "octree", labels );
352  }
353 
354  bool KSNavMeshedSpace::RetrieveTree()
355  {
356  //construct the labels
357  fLabels.clear();
358 
359  std::stringstream se;
360  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSpaces.size(); i++){se << fSpaces[i]->GetName();}
361  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSides.size(); i++){se << fSides[i]->GetName();}
362  for(unsigned int i=0; i<fSurfaces.size(); i++){se << fSurfaces[i]->GetName();}
363  se << fElementMap.size();
364  std::string temp = se.str();
365 
366  //compute a hash for entity data
367  KMD5HashGenerator entity_hasher;
368  std::string entity_hash = entity_hasher.GenerateHashFromString( temp );
369 
370  //concatenate the parameters and hash them too
371  std::stringstream sp;
372  sp << fSpecifyMaxDepth;
373  sp << fSpecifyResolution;
374  sp << fSpecifyAllowedElements;
375 
376  if(fSpecifyMaxDepth){ sp << fMaxDepth; };
377  if(fSpecifyResolution){ sp << fSpecifyResolution; };
378  if(fSpecifyAllowedElements){ sp << fNAllowedElements; };
379  temp = sp.str();
380 
381  KMD5HashGenerator param_hasher;
382  std::string param_hash = param_hasher.GenerateHashFromString( temp );
383 
384  //make and set the unique_id
385  std::stringstream us;
386  us << entity_hash.substr(0,6);
387  us << param_hash.substr(0,6);
388  std::string unique_id = us.str();
389 
390  fLabels.push_back(entity_hash);
391  fLabels.push_back(param_hash);
392  fLabels.push_back(unique_id);
393  fLabels.push_back( GetName() );
394 
395  //switch to the scratch directory
396  std::string previousDirectory = KEMFileInterface::GetInstance()->ActiveDirectory();
397  KEMFileInterface::GetInstance()->ActiveDirectory( std::string(SCRATCH_DEFAULT_DIR) );
398 
399  //find the file by labels
400  std::set< std::string > file_set = KEMFileInterface::GetInstance()->FileNamesWithLabels(fLabels);
401 
402  if(file_set.size() != 1)
403  {
404  return false;
405  }
406  else
407  {
408  //we have tree data, so reconstruct the tree
409  KSNavOctreeData data;
410  fFileName = *(file_set.begin());
411  KEMFileInterface::GetInstance()->ReadLabeled(fFileName, data, fLabels);
412 
413  //reset the active directory to its original state
414  KEMFileInterface::GetInstance()->ActiveDirectory( previousDirectory );
415 
416  //reconstruct tree from the data;
417  unsigned int n_nodes = data.GetNumberOfTreeNodes();
418 
419  //create the tree properties
420  KGSpaceTreeProperties<KGMESH_DIM>* tree_prop = fTree.GetTreeProperties();
421  tree_prop->SetMaxTreeDepth( fMaxDepth );
422  unsigned int dim[KGMESH_DIM];
423  for(unsigned int i=0; i<KGMESH_DIM; i++){ dim[i] = 2;}; //we use an octtree in 3d
424  tree_prop->SetDimensions(dim);
425  tree_prop->SetNeighborOrder(0);
426 
427  //now we need to create a vector of N empty nodes, and enumerate them
428  std::vector< KGMeshNavigationNode* > tree_nodes;
429  tree_nodes.resize(n_nodes, NULL);
430  for(unsigned int i=0; i<n_nodes; i++)
431  {
432  tree_nodes[i] = new KGMeshNavigationNode();
433  tree_nodes[i]->SetID(i);
434 
435  //attach the tree properties to these nodes
436  KGObjectRetriever<KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects, KGSpaceTreeProperties<KGMESH_DIM> >::SetNodeObject(tree_prop, tree_nodes[i]);
437 
438  //attach the mesh element container
439  KGObjectRetriever<KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects, KGNavigableMeshElementContainer >::SetNodeObject(&fElementContainer, tree_nodes[i]);
440  }
441 
442  //now we need to re-link the tree, by connecting child nodes to their parents
443  std::vector<KGNodeData> tree_structure_data;
444  data.GetFlattenedTree(&tree_structure_data);
445 
446  for(unsigned int i=0; i<tree_structure_data.size(); i++)
447  {
448  KGMeshNavigationNode* current_node = tree_nodes[ tree_structure_data[i].GetID() ];
449 
450  //link the children of this current node
451  std::vector<unsigned int> child_ids;
452  tree_structure_data[i].GetChildIDs(&child_ids);
453  for(unsigned int j=0; j<child_ids.size(); j++)
454  {
455  current_node->AddChild( tree_nodes[ child_ids[j] ] );
456  }
457  }
458 
459  //now we need to re-attach objects to the node which owns them
460  std::vector<int> id_set_node_ids;
461  std::vector< KGIdentitySet* > id_sets;
462  data.GetIdentitySetNodeIDs(&id_set_node_ids);
463  data.GetIdentitySets(&id_sets);
464 
465  for(unsigned int i=0; i<id_set_node_ids.size(); i++)
466  {
467  KGMeshNavigationNode* node = tree_nodes[ id_set_node_ids[i] ];
468  KGObjectRetriever<KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects, KGIdentitySet>::SetNodeObject(id_sets[i], node);
469  }
470 
471  std::vector<int> cube_node_ids;
472  std::vector< KGCube<KGMESH_DIM>* > cubes;
473  data.GetCubeNodeIDs(&cube_node_ids);
474  data.GetCubes(&cubes);
475 
476  for(unsigned int i=0; i<cube_node_ids.size(); i++)
477  {
478  KGMeshNavigationNode* node = tree_nodes[ cube_node_ids[i] ];
479  KGObjectRetriever<KGMeshNavigationNodeObjects, KGCube<KGMESH_DIM> >::SetNodeObject(cubes[i], node);
480  }
481 
482  //now replace the tree's root node with the new one
483  fTree.ReplaceRootNode(tree_nodes[0]);
484  return true;
485  }
486  };
487 
488  void KSNavMeshedSpace::CalculateNavigation( const KSTrajectory& aTrajectory, const KSParticle& aTrajectoryInitialParticle,
489  const KSParticle& aTrajectoryFinalParticle, const KThreeVector& aTrajectoryCenter, const double& aTrajectoryRadius,
490  const double& aTrajectoryStep, KSParticle& aNavigationParticle, double& aNavigationStep, bool& aNavigationFlag )
491  {
492  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> calculating navigation:" << eom );
493  KSSpace* tCurrentSpace = aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
494 
495  KThreeVector tInitialPoint = aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetPosition();
496  KThreeVector tFinalPoint = aTrajectoryFinalParticle.GetPosition();
497  double tTime;
498 
499  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
500  fSideEntity = NULL;
501  fSurfaceEntity = NULL;
502  fIsEntry = false;
503 
504  fNavigationFail = false;
505  if(fFailCheck)
506  {
507  //check if the particle is within the space specifed by the octree
508  if( !(fWorldCube->PointIsInside( KGPoint<KGMESH_DIM>(tInitialPoint) ) ) )
509  {
510  navmsg( eWarning ) <<"inital position <" << tInitialPoint.X() <<", "<< tInitialPoint.Y() <<", "<< tInitialPoint.Z() <<"> is outside of octree search volume"<<eom;
511  fNavigationFail = true;
512  aNavigationStep = 0.0;
513  aNavigationFlag = true;
514  return;
515  }
516  }
517 
518  //first we check if the bounding ball of the trajectory comes close enough
519  //to the mesh that an intersection might occur
520  fProximityChecker.SetPointAndRadius(aTrajectoryCenter, aTrajectoryRadius);
521  fProximityChecker.ApplyAction(fTree.GetRootNode()); //TODO: implement some caching on search root node?
522 
523  if( fProximityChecker.SphereIntersectsMesh() )
524  {
525  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> detected trajectory is near mesh elements" << eom );
526 
527  //now we retrieve the piecewise linear approximation to the trajectory
528  aTrajectory.GetPiecewiseLinearApproximation(aTrajectoryInitialParticle, aTrajectoryFinalParticle, &fIntermediateParticleStates);
529 
530  //TODO: may want to add a few stages of recursively subdividing and bounding sub-sections
531  //of the intermediate states to possibley reduce the number of false
532  //positive triggers for an intersection search
533  //(since a bounding ball, while simple, is not the best culling volume for a nearly linear trajectory)
534 
535  std::vector< KSParticle >::iterator startIt = fIntermediateParticleStates.begin();
536  std::vector< KSParticle >::iterator stopIt = startIt; stopIt++;
537 
538  unsigned int repeatCount = 0;
539  unsigned int seg = 0;
540  while( stopIt != fIntermediateParticleStates.end() )
541  {
542  tInitialPoint = startIt->GetPosition();
543  tFinalPoint = stopIt->GetPosition();
544  double length = (tFinalPoint - tInitialPoint).Magnitude();
545 
546  fFirstIntersectionFinder.SetLineSegment(tInitialPoint, tFinalPoint);
547 
548  //TODO: implement some caching on search root node?
549  fFirstIntersectionFinder.ApplyAction(fTree.GetRootNode());
550 
551  if( fFirstIntersectionFinder.HasIntersectionWithMesh() )
552  {
553 
554  //this segment of the trajectory has an intersection
555  //compute the the time to intersection
556  KThreeVector tIntersection = fFirstIntersectionFinder.GetIntersection();
557 
558  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> has detected a possible intersection" << eom );
559 
560  KThreeVector tDirection = (tFinalPoint - tInitialPoint).Unit();
561  double distance = (tIntersection - tInitialPoint).Magnitude();
562  double t = (stopIt->GetTime() - startIt->GetTime());
563  double v1 = (startIt->GetVelocity()).Dot(tDirection);
564  double v2 = (stopIt->GetVelocity()).Dot(tDirection);
565  double tDelta = SolveForTime(distance, t, v1, v2);
566  tTime = startIt->GetTime() + tDelta;
567 
568  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> estimates time step of "<<tDelta<< eom );
569 
570  //sanity check
571  if( tTime > stopIt->GetTime() ){tTime = stopIt->GetTime();};
572  if( tTime < startIt->GetTime() ){tTime = startIt->GetTime();};
573 
574  //now deterimine what object it has encountered
575  //get the mesh element and its id
576  const KGNavigableMeshElement* mesh_elem = fFirstIntersectionFinder.GetIntersectedMeshElement();
577  fMeshElementID = mesh_elem->GetID();
578 
579  //TODO: we need to explicitly deal with the case where we are both intersecting
580  //a side and a space at the same time (this is more complicated than it sounds)
581 
582  //look up the mesh elements parent entity to determine if we
583  //hit a parent side, child side, or surface, we also check to
584  //see if this intersection extremely close to the last surface/space
585  //crossing (if it is, its probably because of numerical error) and we should ignore it
586  bool validIntersection = true;
587  bool skipSegment = false;
588 
589  double dist_to_add = 0.0;
590  double dist_from_last = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
591 
592  switch (fElementMap[fMeshElementID].fType)
593  {
594  case KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SPACE:
595  //intersection with space element
596  fSpaceEntity = fElementMap[fMeshElementID].fSpace;
597  fSideEntity = NULL;
598  fSurfaceEntity = NULL;
599 
600  if(tCurrentSpace == fSpaceEntity)
601  {
602  //we are exiting the current space
603  fIsEntry = false;
604  }
605  else
606  {
607  //we have an entry
608  fIsEntry = true;
609  }
610 
611  dist_from_last = (tIntersection - fLastIntersection).Magnitude();
612  if(dist_from_last < fRelativeTolerance*length || dist_from_last < fAbsoluteTolerance)
613  {
614  if(dist_from_last > fRelativeTolerance*length){dist_to_add = fAbsoluteTolerance;}
615  else{dist_to_add = fRelativeTolerance*length;}
616 
617  //just started tracking this particle
618  if( fLastSpaceEntity == NULL )
619  {
620  navmsg_debug( " invalid intersection detected near starting position on <" << fSpaceEntity->GetName() << ">" << eom );
621  validIntersection = false;
622  }
623  else if(fLastSpaceEntity == fSpaceEntity )
624  {
625  //same entity or very close to last intersection
626  navmsg_debug( " invalid intersection detected near previous intersection on "<< fSpaceEntity->GetName() << ">" << eom );
627  validIntersection = false;
628  }
629  }
630  else if(fLastSpaceEntity == fSpaceEntity || fLastSpaceEntity == NULL)
631  {
632  //check if navigation count is within 1 step
633  //and distance from last intersection is within the length of the segment
634  //and n segments is more than 1
635  if( (fNavigationCount - fLastSpaceCount <= 1) && (dist_from_last < length) )
636  {
637  //very likely have an invalid intersection due to numerical round off
638  //but because the absolute/relative tolerances are too tight
639  //it has not been detected, so we issue a debug warning and skip this segment
640  navmsg(eWarning) << " skipping segment because invalid intersection detected near previous intersection at on <" << fSpaceEntity->GetName() << ">, your navigator tolerances are probably too small!" << eom;
641 
642  validIntersection = false;
643  skipSegment = true;
644  }
645  }
646 
647  break;
648  case KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SIDE:
649  //intersection with side element
650  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
651  fSideEntity = fElementMap[fMeshElementID].fSide;
652  fSurfaceEntity = NULL;
653 
654  dist_from_last = (tIntersection - fLastIntersection).Magnitude();
655  if(dist_from_last < fRelativeTolerance*aTrajectoryRadius || dist_from_last < fAbsoluteTolerance)
656  {
657  if(dist_from_last > fRelativeTolerance*aTrajectoryRadius){dist_to_add = fAbsoluteTolerance;}
658  else{dist_to_add = fRelativeTolerance*aTrajectoryRadius;}
659 
660  //just started tracking this particle
661  if( fLastSideEntity == NULL )
662  {
663  navmsg_debug( " invalid intersection detected near starting position at on <" << fSideEntity->GetName() << ">" << eom );
664  validIntersection = false;
665  }
666  else if(fLastSideEntity == fSideEntity )
667  {
668  //same entity or very close to last intersection
669  navmsg_debug( " invalid intersection detected near previous intersection at on <" << fSideEntity->GetName() << ">" << eom );
670  validIntersection = false;
671  }
672  }
673  else if(fLastSideEntity == fSideEntity || fLastSideEntity == NULL)
674  {
675  //check if navigation count is within 1 step
676  //and distance from last intersection is within the length of the segment
677  //and n segments is more than 1
678  if( (fNavigationCount - fLastSideCount <= 1) && (dist_from_last < length) )
679  {
680  //very likely have an invalid intersection due to numerical round off
681  //but because the absolute/relative tolerances are too tight
682  //it has not been detected, so we issue a debug warning and skip this segment
683  navmsg(eWarning) << " skipping segment because invalid intersection detected near previous intersection at on <" << fSideEntity->GetName() << ">, your navigator tolerances are probably too small!" << eom ;
684  validIntersection = false;
685  skipSegment = true;
686  }
687  }
688 
689  break;
690  case KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SURFACE:
691  //intersection with surface element
692  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
693  fSideEntity = NULL;
694  fSurfaceEntity = fElementMap[fMeshElementID].fSurface;
695 
696  dist_from_last = (tIntersection - fLastIntersection).Magnitude();
697  if(dist_from_last < fRelativeTolerance*aTrajectoryRadius || dist_from_last < fAbsoluteTolerance)
698  {
699  if(dist_from_last > fRelativeTolerance*aTrajectoryRadius){dist_to_add = fAbsoluteTolerance;}
700  else{dist_to_add = fRelativeTolerance*aTrajectoryRadius;}
701 
702  //just started tracking this particle
703  if( fLastSurfaceEntity == NULL )
704  {
705  navmsg_debug( " invalid intersection detected near starting position at on <" << fSurfaceEntity->GetName() << ">" << eom );
706  validIntersection = false;
707  }
708  else if(fLastSurfaceEntity == fSurfaceEntity )
709  {
710  //same entity or very close to last intersection
711  navmsg_debug( " invalid intersection detected near previous intersection at on <" << fSurfaceEntity->GetName() << ">" << eom );
712  validIntersection = false;
713  }
714  }
715  else if(fLastSurfaceEntity == fSurfaceEntity || fLastSurfaceEntity == NULL)
716  {
717  //check if navigation count is within 1 step
718  //and distance from last intersection is within the length of the segment
719  //and n segments is more than 1
720  if( (fNavigationCount - fLastSurfaceCount <= 1) && (dist_from_last < length) )
721  {
722  //very likely have an invalid intersection due to numerical round off
723  //but because the absolute/relative tolerances are too tight
724  //it has not been detected, so we issue a debug warning and skip this segment
725  navmsg(eWarning) << " skipping segment because invalid intersection detected near previous intersection at on <" << fSurfaceEntity->GetName() << ">, your navigator tolerances are probably too small!" << eom;
726  validIntersection = false;
727  skipSegment = true;
728  }
729  }
730 
731  break;
732  };
733 
734  seg++;
735 
736  if(validIntersection) //intersection is not a repeat of the last
737  {
738  //compute the particle state at the intersection
739  aNavigationParticle = aTrajectoryInitialParticle;
740  aNavigationParticle.SetCurrentSpace(tCurrentSpace);
741  aNavigationStep = tTime - aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetTime();
742  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory(aNavigationStep, aNavigationParticle);
743  aNavigationFlag = true;
744 
745  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> detected valid intersection after time step: "<<aNavigationStep << eom );
746 
747  return;
748  }
749  else
750  {
751  //we have a repeated intersection due to numerical error
752  //however we need to check the remainder of this current segment,
753  //this is needed in case of a very thin volume
754  //because if we discard the rest of this segment without checking for additional
755  //intersections we might miss the next surface just past the current one
756  //so compute a point just beyond the repeated intersection
757 
758  if(skipSegment)
759  {
760  //this entire segment is too close to last intersection
761  //go to next one
762  startIt++;
763  stopIt++;
764  repeatCount = 0;
765  continue;
766  }
767 
768  if(repeatCount < 4) //avoid infinite loop in case of severe problems
769  {
770  distance += dist_to_add;
771  if(distance < length)
772  {
773  navmsg_debug( " incrementing intersection search by <" << dist_to_add << "> and continuing " << eom );
774  tTime = startIt->GetTime() + SolveForTime(distance, t, v1, v2);
775  //sanity check
776  if( tTime > stopIt->GetTime() ){tTime = stopIt->GetTime();};
777  if( tTime < startIt->GetTime() ){tTime = startIt->GetTime();};
778  double step = tTime - aTrajectoryInitialParticle.GetTime();
779  aTrajectory.ExecuteTrajectory(step, *startIt);
780  repeatCount++;
781  continue;
782  }
783  else
784  {
785  navmsg_debug( " skipping trajectory segment because it is entirely within tolerance of the last intersection " << eom );
786  //this entire segment is too close to last intersection
787  //go to next one
788  startIt++;
789  stopIt++;
790  repeatCount = 0;
791  continue;
792  }
793  }
794  else
795  {
796  navmsg_debug( "skipping trajectory segment after reaching incremental search limit " << eom );
797  }
798  }
799  }
800 
801  //update iterator for next segment
802  startIt++;
803  stopIt++;
804  repeatCount = 0;
805  }
806  }
807 
808 
809  //no intersections
810  aNavigationParticle.SetCurrentSpace(tCurrentSpace);
811  aNavigationParticle = aTrajectoryFinalParticle;
812  aNavigationStep = aTrajectoryStep;
813  aNavigationFlag = false;
814 
815  return;
816  }
817 
818  void KSNavMeshedSpace::ExecuteNavigation( const KSParticle& aNavigationParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& aParticleQueue ) const
819  {
820  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> executing navigation:" << eom );
821 
822  //kill the particle if the navigation was wrong
823  if( fNavigationFail )
824  {
825  fNavigationFail = false;
826  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
827  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
828  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "navigator_fail" );
829  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
830  return;
831  }
832 
833  //we had a space intersection
834  if(fSpaceEntity != NULL)
835  {
836  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
837  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
838  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fSpaceEntity->GetName() );
839 
840  if(fIsEntry)
841  {
842  navmsg( eNormal ) << " space <" << fSpaceEntity->GetName() << "> was entered "<<eom;
843  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "enter" );
844 
845  if( fEnterSplit == true )
846  {
847  KSParticle* tEnterSplitParticle = new KSParticle( aFinalParticle );
848  tEnterSplitParticle->SetCurrentSpace( fSpaceEntity );
849  tEnterSplitParticle->SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
850  tEnterSplitParticle->SetCurrentSide( NULL );
851  tEnterSplitParticle->ResetFieldCaching();
852  aParticleQueue.push_back( tEnterSplitParticle );
853  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
854  }
855 
856  }
857  else
858  {
859  navmsg( eNormal ) << " space <" << fSpaceEntity->GetName() << "> was exited "<< eom;
860  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "exit" );
861 
862  bool world_exit = false;
863  if(fSpaceEntity->GetParent() == NULL)
864  {
865  world_exit = true;
866  }
867 
868  if(fExitSplit == true && !world_exit)
869  {
870  KSParticle* tExitSplitParticle = new KSParticle( aFinalParticle );
871  tExitSplitParticle->SetCurrentSpace( fSpaceEntity->GetParent() );
872  tExitSplitParticle->SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
873  tExitSplitParticle->SetCurrentSide( NULL );
874  tExitSplitParticle->ResetFieldCaching();
875  aParticleQueue.push_back( tExitSplitParticle );
876  aFinalParticle.SetActive( false );
877  }
878 
879  //particle has exited the world volume, kill it
880  if(world_exit)
881  {
882  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
883  aFinalParticle.AddLabel("world_exit");
884  aFinalParticle.SetActive(false);
885  }
886  }
887 
888  return;
889  }
890 
891  if(fSideEntity != NULL)
892  {
893  navmsg( eNormal )<< " side <" << fSideEntity->GetName() << "> was crossed" << eom;
894  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;;
895  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
896  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fSideEntity->GetName() );
897  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "crossed" );
898  return;
899  }
900 
901  if(fSurfaceEntity != NULL)
902  {
903  navmsg( eNormal ) << " surface <" << fSurfaceEntity->GetName() << "> was crossed" << eom;
904  aFinalParticle = aNavigationParticle;
905  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
906  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( fSurfaceEntity->GetName() );
907  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( "crossed" );
908  return;
909  }
910 
911  navmsg( eError ) << "could not determine space navigation" << eom;
912 
913  return;
914  }
915 
916 
917  void KSNavMeshedSpace::FinalizeNavigation( KSParticle& aFinalParticle ) const
918  {
919  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> finalizing navigation:" << eom );
920 
921  //we had a space intersection
922  if(fSpaceEntity != NULL)
923  {
924  if(fIsEntry)
925  {
926  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for exiting of space <" << fSpaceEntity->GetName() << "> " << eom );
927  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSpace( fSpaceEntity );
928  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSide( NULL );
929  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
930  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
931 
932  fLastEntityType = KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SPACE;
933  fLastMeshElementID = fMeshElementID;
934  fLastSpaceEntity = fSpaceEntity;
935  fLastSideEntity = NULL;
936  fLastSurfaceEntity = NULL;
937  fLastIntersection = aFinalParticle.GetPosition();
938  fLastDirection = aFinalParticle.GetMomentum().Unit();
939 
940  fSpaceEntity->Enter();
941  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
942 
943  fLastSpaceCount = fNavigationCount;
944  }
945  else
946  {
947  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for entering of space <" << fSpaceEntity->GetName() << "> " << eom );
948  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSpace( fSpaceEntity->GetParent() );
949  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSide( NULL );
950  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
951  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
952 
953  fLastEntityType = KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SPACE;
954  fLastMeshElementID = fMeshElementID;
955  fLastSpaceEntity = fSpaceEntity;
956  fLastSideEntity = NULL;
957  fLastSurfaceEntity = NULL;
958  fLastIntersection = aFinalParticle.GetPosition();
959  fLastDirection = aFinalParticle.GetMomentum().Unit();
960 
961  fSpaceEntity->Exit();
962  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
963 
964  fLastSpaceCount = fNavigationCount;
965  }
966 
967  fNavigationCount++;
968  return;
969  }
970 
971  if(fSideEntity != NULL)
972  {
973  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for crossing of side <" << fSideEntity->GetName() << "> " << eom );
974 
975  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSide( fSideEntity );
976  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSurface( NULL );
977  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
978 
979  fLastEntityType = KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SIDE;
980  fLastMeshElementID = fMeshElementID;
981  fLastSpaceEntity = aFinalParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
982  fLastSideEntity = fSideEntity;
983  fLastSurfaceEntity = NULL;
984  fLastIntersection = aFinalParticle.GetPosition();
985  fLastDirection = aFinalParticle.GetMomentum().Unit();
986 
987  fSideEntity->On();
988  fSideEntity = NULL;
989 
990  fLastSideCount = fNavigationCount;
991  fNavigationCount++;
992  return;
993  }
994 
995  if(fSurfaceEntity != NULL)
996  {
997  navmsg_debug( " finalizing navigation for crossing of surface <" << fSurfaceEntity->GetName() << "> " << eom );
998 
999  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSide( NULL );
1000  aFinalParticle.SetCurrentSurface( fSurfaceEntity );
1001  aFinalParticle.ResetFieldCaching();
1002 
1003  fLastEntityType = KSNAVMESHEDSPACE_SURFACE;
1004  fLastMeshElementID = fMeshElementID;
1005  fLastSpaceEntity = aFinalParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
1006  fLastSideEntity = NULL;
1007  fLastSurfaceEntity = fSurfaceEntity;
1008  fLastIntersection = aFinalParticle.GetPosition();
1009  fLastDirection = aFinalParticle.GetMomentum().Unit();
1010 
1011  fSurfaceEntity->On();
1012  fSurfaceEntity = NULL;
1013 
1014  fLastSurfaceCount = fNavigationCount;
1015  fNavigationCount++;
1016  return;
1017  }
1018 
1019  navmsg( eError ) << "could not finalize space navigation" << eom;
1020 
1021  return;
1022  }
1023 
1024 
1025  void KSNavMeshedSpace::StartNavigation( KSParticle& aParticle, KSSpace* aRoot )
1026  {
1027  // reset navigation
1028  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
1029  fSideEntity = NULL;
1030  fSurfaceEntity = NULL;
1031  fNavigationCount = 0;
1032  fLastSideCount = 0;
1033  fLastSpaceCount = 0;
1034  fLastSurfaceCount = 0;
1035 
1036  fLastSpaceEntity = aParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
1037  fLastSurfaceEntity = aParticle.GetCurrentSurface();
1038  fLastSideEntity = aParticle.GetCurrentSide();
1039 
1040  fLastIntersection = aParticle.GetPosition();
1041 
1042  navmsg_debug( "navigation space <" << this->GetName() << "> starting navigation:" << eom );
1043 
1044  if( aParticle.GetCurrentSpace() == NULL )
1045  {
1046  navmsg_debug( " computing fresh initial state" << eom );
1047  int tIndex = 0;
1048  KSSpace* tParentSpace = aRoot;
1049  KSSpace* tSpace = NULL;
1050  while( tIndex < tParentSpace->GetSpaceCount() )
1051  {
1052  tSpace = tParentSpace->GetSpace( tIndex );
1053  if( tSpace->Outside( aParticle.GetPosition() ) == false )
1054  {
1055  navmsg_debug( " activating space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1056  tSpace->Enter();
1057  tParentSpace = tSpace;
1058  tIndex = 0;
1059  }
1060  else
1061  {
1062  navmsg_debug( " skipping space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1063  tIndex++;
1064  }
1065  }
1066 
1067  aParticle.SetCurrentSpace( tParentSpace );
1068  }
1069  else
1070  {
1071  navmsg_debug( " entering given initial state" << eom );
1072 
1073  KSSpace* tSpace = aParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
1074  KSSurface* tSurface = aParticle.GetCurrentSurface();
1075  KSSide* tSide = aParticle.GetCurrentSide();
1076  deque< KSSpace* > tSequence;
1077 
1078  // get into the correct space state
1079  while( tSpace != aRoot && tSpace != NULL )
1080  {
1081  tSequence.push_front( tSpace );
1082  tSpace = tSpace->GetParent();
1083  }
1084 
1085  for( deque< KSSpace* >::iterator tIt = tSequence.begin(); tIt != tSequence.end(); tIt++ )
1086  {
1087  tSpace = *tIt;
1088  navmsg_debug( " entering space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1089  tSpace->Enter();
1090  }
1091 
1092  if ( tSurface != NULL )
1093  {
1094  navmsg_debug( " activating surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1095  tSurface->On();
1096  }
1097 
1098  if ( tSide != NULL )
1099  {
1100  navmsg_debug( " activating side <" << tSide->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1101  tSide->On();
1102  }
1103  }
1104  return;
1105  }
1106 
1107  void KSNavMeshedSpace::StopNavigation( KSParticle& aParticle, KSSpace* aRoot )
1108  {
1109  // reset navigation
1110  fSpaceEntity = NULL;
1111  fSideEntity = NULL;
1112  fSurfaceEntity = NULL;
1113  fNavigationCount = 0;
1114  fLastSideCount = 0;
1115  fLastSpaceCount = 0;
1116  fLastSurfaceCount = 0;
1117 
1118  fLastSideEntity = NULL;
1119  fLastSpaceEntity = NULL;
1120  fLastSurfaceEntity = NULL;
1121 
1122  deque< KSSpace* > tSpaces;
1123 
1124  KSSpace* tSpace = aParticle.GetCurrentSpace();
1125  KSSurface* tSurface = aParticle.GetCurrentSurface();
1126  KSSide* tSide = aParticle.GetCurrentSide();
1127 
1128  // undo side state
1129  if( tSide != NULL )
1130  {
1131  navmsg_debug( " deactivating side <" << tSide->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1132  tSide->Off();
1133  }
1134 
1135  // undo surface state
1136  if( tSurface != NULL )
1137  {
1138  navmsg_debug( " deactivating surface <" << tSurface->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1139  tSurface->Off();
1140  }
1141 
1142  // undo space state
1143  while( tSpace != aRoot && tSpace != NULL )
1144  {
1145  tSpaces.push_back( tSpace );
1146  tSpace = tSpace->GetParent();
1147  }
1148  for( deque< KSSpace* >::iterator tIt = tSpaces.begin(); tIt != tSpaces.end(); tIt++ )
1149  {
1150  tSpace = *tIt;
1151  navmsg_debug( " deactivating space <" << tSpace->GetName() << ">" << eom );
1152  tSpace->Exit();
1153  }
1154 
1155  return;
1156  }
1157 
1158  double
1159  KSNavMeshedSpace::SolveForTime(double distance, double t, double v1, double v2) const
1160  {
1161  //solving for the time to travel the specified distance
1162  //along a straight line path with initial velocity
1163  //v1 and final velocity v2, assuming constant acceleration
1164  double acc = (v2 - v1)/t;
1165 
1166  //solve the quadratic
1167  double a = 0.5*acc;
1168  double b = v1;
1169  double c = -1.0*distance;
1170  double disc = b*b - 4.0*a*c;
1171 
1172  if(disc < 0.0)
1173  {
1174  if(std::fabs(disc) < (1e-13)*b*b )
1175  {
1176  //disc became negative because of rounding error
1177  //clamp to zero return single root
1178  return -b/(2.0*a);
1179  }
1180  else
1181  {
1182  //something went wrong with the coefficients, compute the linear estimate
1183  return distance/((v1+v2)/2.0);
1184  }
1185  }
1186 
1187  bool x1_is_valid = true;
1188  bool x2_is_valid = true;
1189 
1190  disc = std::sqrt(disc);
1191  double x1 = (-b + disc)/(2.0*a);
1192  double x2 = (-b - disc)/(2.0*a);
1193 
1194  if(x1 < 0.0 || x1 > t){x1_is_valid = false;};
1195  if(x2 < 0.0 || x1 > t){x2_is_valid = false;};
1196 
1197  if( !x1_is_valid && !x2_is_valid )
1198  {
1199  //something went wrong with the coefficients, compute the linear estimate
1200  return distance/((v1+v2)/2.0);
1201  }
1202  else
1203  {
1204  if(x1_is_valid && x2_is_valid)
1205  {
1206  if(x1 < x2)
1207  {
1208  return x1;
1209  }
1210  else
1211  {
1212  return x2;
1213  }
1214  }
1215  if(x1_is_valid){return x1;};
1216  if(x2_is_valid){return x2;};
1217  }
1218 
1219  //should never reach here, but if we do return end-point
1220  return t;
1221  }
1222 
1223 
1224 }
KEMField
Definition: KSElectricKEMField.h:13
KGeoBag
